captions.text: In the previous part, the BMW Nine T review drove us to Germany, at Glemseck Festival
Glemseck is more than a Café Racer festival

In 8 years, this event has considerably grown. 
Today it attracts around 40,000 people
and if the vintage spirit dominates, there is much more to see.
Eye watering customized bikes, of course
Some that are… less elegants
Hairdresser
Concerts
Pretty faces
Pretty asses, too
Fries and sausages
But must of all, the reason why people are coming here : the runs !
The first competition of the weekend was the International Sprint.
A kind of gentlemen fight, between some motorcycles world VIPs.
With some customs bike builders, retired riders or still in action, and wickedly customized bikes.
Among these guests, we met Nicolas Sonina.
Former Moto Journal’s reporter, Iron Bikers event creator,
our friend came here with a beautiful Yamaha 350 RDLC.
Well, the poor Nico could not do anything against big four stroke much more powerful.
Especially when one of them was between the hands of Katia Poengsen,
former GP 250 rider, who didn’t loose anything of her talent in clutch handling.
Among all these bikes, one of them was particularly interesting for us.
Must say that we clearly came for it
Here is a BMW Nine T fed with hormones,
prepared by Edelweiss Motorsports, and driven by Markus Reiterberger
Superbike German champion in 2013.
With a flat twin totally reviewed and announced over than 150 hp,
Markus has dominated his opponents ...
In the final round, he had to admit defeat against Sylvain Bergeron,
who was riding an hybrid Suzuki powered by an Inazuma engine high in vitamins
At the end, the Frenchman won.
After the laurels, he was kind enough to give us his secrets
I make “brake starts”.
I mean that I use front brake, I release the clutch to stretch the chain at the maximum
and when the flag come down, I release everything and I open the throttle !
Well, in Glemseck 101, all the bikes are not necessarily big guns.
We also saw some old wheezy 50 cc
Few stroller starts
Or old motorcycles which are not really… green !
All these runs, the popular success, that’s fine but… In fact, how old is Glemseck 101 ?
When it’s time to have fun, there is a category which is really rocks. Its name is Star Wars
And any types of vehicles are authorized, from the time their engine is mounted in a rigid frame.
It's a bit like a do-it-yoursel fair.
With some choppers powered by a big 4 cylinder in line,
some beautiful mechanical,
some interesting decorations,
some jovial bikers… and the fans that go with.
There is also this little gem, ridden by a French man, Sébastien Lorentz.
In addition to being noisy, very noisy,
we can say that this missile on wheels works rather well. Because Sébastien won the final round.
The frame comes from a 1955 R50, serie 2
About the engine, the carters come from a 1978 RS
I have cylinder heads from a 1991-1992 GS,
the gear box is a 1992 R100 R, the battery is a S1000 RR one… wich is funny.
And the fork is from 1969. All  the generations are mixed.
Among all these great machines, we almost forgot why we came here.
The BMW Nine T, and the alternatives proposed by the finest European custom bikes builders.
First, there is this elegant Cafe Racer.
Cap light, checked flag, we crawl into a very British style.
Then, another Cafe Racer created by Unique Custom Cycles.
Pure lines, minimalist look but flashy color. We love it.
Or this dirt bike, manufactured by Blitz.
The French guys are certainly holding up on their style, but here is a big innovation,
because the tank of this bike has been completed and made with a 3D printer.
Finally, there is this variation produced by El Solitario, escaped from the movie Mad Max.
His name : Impostor !
The style is clearly different, original, and leaves no one indifferent
You love it, or you hate it.
Icing on the cake, designers and their toys had a little race.
Just to prove that a work of art, can also be used with the throttle wide open...
A little race won by the Nine T from UCC.
Nine T overflow . It was time for us to leave Glemseck, and take on the road again.

title: BMW Nine T Part. 2 : Glemseck - Vitesse, belles motos et style ! (English Subtitles)
